description: This technological development is more significant than the public may realize
title: Zuckerberg's AI Metaverse Is Beginning to Look Like a Bond Villain's Dream
summary:
Remember back in 2022, when many laughed as the media reported that Mark Zuckerberg’s “Metaverse” was a multi-billion-dollar failure?
To streamline the process, Zuckerberg stated that he intends to replace the Meta Quest Pro headsets with Meta sunglasses.
So, why care about Zuckerberg’s virtual technology?
Because Zuckerberg has set his sights on dominating the landscape of virtual reality, mixed reality, and AI.
Now there is reality.” Zuckerberg is about to create — and own — our new virtual reality.

description: This arena is already a major source of revenue growth for Meta Platforms.
title: Mark Zuckerberg Says That This Will Be "the Next Major Pillar" of Meta's Business -- and It's Not the Metaverse
summary:
CEO Mark Zuckerberg recently weighed in on this question and, surprisingly, he didn't say the "next major pillar" of Meta's business would be the metaverse.
Meta's next big businessIn Meta's Q3 earnings call, Zuckerberg told analysts that the company's next major business will be ... business messaging.
Over time, Zuckerberg believes that Meta will be able to "grow the business messaging business in a big way."
While people across the world use WhatsApp for personal messaging, business messaging has become an increasingly important service for the platform.
CFO Susan Li said that this impressive growth was "driven by strong business messaging revenue growth from our WhatsApp Business Platform."

description: The unofficial game has carried 80,000 passengers on more than a million flights – our writer gave it a try
title: I played the metaverse Ryanair simulator and was detained at Bristol Airport
authors: ['Jack Rear', 'David Farley', 'Telegraph Ski', 'Sophie Dickinson', 'Teresa Levonian Cole', 'Hazel Plush', 'Jo']
summary:
I don’t even feel the hands on me as I’m hauled out of the queue by a heavy-set security guard in front of all my fellow travellers at Bristol Airport and frogmarched to a private security office.
This is every traveller’s worst nightmare.
“I’m so sorry, I’ve never done this before, please don’t kick me out of the airport,” I beg.
As I look to my left, I see the Duolingo mascot being escorted into the room by another security guard, Homer Simpson leers in from the corridor outside.
“I don’t know what I’m doing, I’m playing this in virtual reality,” I moan.

description: Spyglass Media Group and Sony Pictures have teamed up with MeetKai to create a horror metaverse experience for an upcoming film.
title: Sony Pictures, Spyglass Media and MeetKai create Survive Thanksgiving horror metaverse
summary:
Watch NowSpyglass Media Group and Sony Pictures have teamed up with AI and metaverse company MeetKai to create a horror metaverse experience for the upcoming horror film Thanksgiving.
Dubbed Survive Thanksgiving, the metaverse experience is the first one created by the parties to help launch a theatrical movie release.
Survive Thanksgiving, developed on MeetKai’s metaverse platform, transports players into a nightmarish reality set in the peaceful town of Plymouth, Massachusetts.
The metaverse world of Survive Thanksgiving, created by Spyglass Media Group, Sony Pictures, and MeetKai, launches today on Halloween.
For an exclusive cinematic experience, the film Thanksgiving will be available in theaters starting November 17, 2023.

description: Meta has lost $46.5 billion on the metaverse since 2019, more than the revenue of Best Buy or United Airlines.
title: Mark Zuckerberg’s $46.5 billion loss on the metaverse is so huge it would be a Fortune 100 company—but his net worth is up even more than that
summary:
Meta’s Reality Labs division, which houses its efforts to break into the metaverse, has lost around $46.5 billion since 2019, the company revealed in its latest earnings report.
That $46.5 billion figure is more than the entire revenue for Best Buy, which ranks 94 on the Fortune 100.
The company had $95 billion in revenue through the third quarter of this year and $30 billion in profits.
Almost all—99%—of Meta’s revenue comes from the company’s family of apps.
This year, Meta released two new products from Reality Labs: Quest 3, a new VR headset; and Ray Ban–branded smart glasses.

description: His long-term bet still stands, though | Business
title: How Mark Zuckerberg escaped a metaverse-sized hole
summary:
In response to investor pressure, Mr Zuckerberg performed one of the fastest pivots in tech history.
When Mr Zuckerberg realised he had incensed investors, those around him say, he did not panic.
As Nick Clegg, a close adviser to Mr Zuckerberg, explains, his boss doesn’t like people around him “shouting and yelling”.
When asked to describe Mr Zuckerberg, she says he is “bright, driven but perhaps a bit too fond of his own ideas”.
Still, Mr Zuckerberg has “not resiled at all” from his long-term bet, Mr Clegg says.

description: Facebook-parent Meta has lost $47 billion in its metaverse division in under five years, a sum that's close to the market value of Chipotle or Target.
title: Zuckerberg's $47 Billion Metaverse Loss Is Bigger Than Ford, Hershey
summary:
Mark Zuckerberg's Meta has recorded nearly $50 billion of metaverse losses in under five years.
"We expect our RL operating losses to increase meaningfully in 2024," they noted in Meta's third-quarter earnings.
Meta's metaverse losses to date exceed the market capitalization of Ford ($45 billion), Keurig Dr. Pepper ($41 billion), Hershey ($39 billion), Kraft Heinz ($39 billion), and many other large companies.
They could soon overtake Lululemon ($49 billion), Chipotle ($50 billion), Target ($51 billion), and Monster Beverage ($52 billion) in size.
They would also be worth nearly half as much as Zuckerberg ($105 billion).

description: The global aerospace, defence & security industry experienced a 4% decline in the number of metaverse related patent applications in Q3 2023 compared with the previous quarter, according to GlobalData's Patent Analytics.
title: Metaverse related patent filings increased in the aerospace, defence ...
summary:
The global aerospace, defence & security industry experienced a 4% rise in the number of metaverse-related patent applications in Q3 2023 compared with the previous quarter.
Notably, the number of metaverse-related patent applications in the aerospace, defence & security industry was 82 in Q3 2023, versus 79 in the prior quarter.
The top five companies accounted for 43% of patenting activityAnalysis of patenting activity by companies shows that Boeing filed the most metaverse patents within the aerospace, defence & security industry in Q3 2023.
It was followed by Safran with 3 metaverse patent filings, U.S. Department of Defence (3 filings), and State Farm Mutual Automobile Insurance (2 filings) in Q3 2023.
For further understanding of GlobalData's Aerospace, Defense & Security: Patents Trends Q3 2023, buy the databook here.

title: Paul Merage School of Business launches digital twin 'metaversity'
summary:
A new era of immersive and 3D classrooms will enable students in UCI’s Paul Merage School of Business to learn in a virtual reality environment.
In partnership with VictoryXR, the school is creating a cutting-edge digital twin, known as a metaversity, that will facilitate collaboration between students and professors in a simulated campus setting.
The digital twin of the Merage School offers a faithful representation of the physical campus and extends its possibilities into the virtual realm.
On Thursday, Nov. 2, the Merage School will host a virtual ribbon-cutting ceremony to celebrate the launch of the metaversity.
“The digital twin of the Merage School represents the start of a journey for our university,” said Tom Andriola, UCI vice chancellor for data and information technology.

description: The big draw, and gamble, of the Metaverse is the ability to experience events from a front-row seat—or an even more intimate or fantastic vantage point.
title: In The Metaverse, Everyone Has A Front Row Seat
summary:
In Mark Zuckerberg’s $14 billion virtual reality known as the Metaverse, a dreamscape where Fantasy Island and Fantasia meet, experiencing anything and going anywhere is seemingly possible.
Photo Credit: Woody RoselandMeta’s big gamble isn’t about viewing places and events, it’s about experiencing them in a front-row seat.
Over 1.5 million attended ticketed events at Red Rocks in 2022.
One new project that Meta is cooking up is a virtual concert experience from Colorado’s famed Red Rocks Amphitheater.
Robert Watts is Co-founder and Executive Producer at Light Sail VR, a boutique production company ... [+] specializing in creative storytelling in Virtual Reality.

summary:

Epic Games has fast become one of the leading companies behind the evolution of the metaverse, including holding numerous virtual events within Fortnite.
In 2022, the company raised US$2bn to fund other metaverse initiatives, including Unreal Engine to create immersive experiences in simulated environments.
Through the platform, developers can use the Unity Engine to develop metaverse experiences.
While the platform was built for game developers, it is also widely used by industrial users to create custom metaverse and digital twin solutions.

description: Persona 5 was already etched deep within my heart so it was almost impossible not to have lofty expectations for Persona 5 Tactica. It did not disappoint. Persona 5 Tactica is another riveting RPG addition to the Persona franchise offering new mysteries, strategic combat, and dynamic visuals. Bringi
title: Persona 5 Tactica impressions — A New Adventure in a New ...
summary:
Persona 5 was already etched deep within my heart so it was almost impossible not to have lofty expectations for Persona 5 Tactica.
Persona 5 Tactica is another riveting RPG addition to the Persona franchise offering new mysteries, strategic combat, and dynamic visuals.
Bringing in characteristics from its predecessor, Persona 5 Tactica crashed in with style and dynamic artistry from astonishing 3D elements to vibrant 2D graphics.
Pulling a Triple Threat is sort of like Persona 5’s “All-Out Attack” where the team unites, attacking enemies caught in the triangle loop.
Persona 5 Tactica assembles the team back together, introduces Erina, and will have you engaging in yet another compelling story.

description: EY uses the metaverse into its internships as a way to educate interns on the global accounting consultancy's culture, purpose and values in a fun and memorable way.
title: EY Internship Incorporates Metaverse
summary:
"WeVerse," an online metaverse experience launched this year, is a way to educate interns on the global accounting consultancy's culture, purpose and values in a fun and memorable way, said Domhnaill Hernon, EY's global Metaverse Labs lead.
The WeVerse experience resonated with Park, a Middle Tennessee State University student whose friends develop video games.
However, while the metaverse was the media used, the content EY developed was not wholly tech-centric, Carlier said.
Carlier advises employers to consider the "why" in developing a metaverse as part of the internship experience.
EY invited employees of younger generations, and interns such as Park, to test WeVerse prior to launch.

summary:

At the same time, new AI tech is being deployed by some companies to develop more compelling virtual experiences.
These are two themes that will be on display at the inaugural AI World Fair.

description: "It was hell working on it," says Andre Elijah, the miffed developer of the AEI Fitness app.
title: Meta killed a metaverse yoga app upon learning its developer also talked with Apple, a lawsuit alleges: ‘It was hell working on it’
summary:
Meta Platforms Inc. killed it just before launch time when Meta learned Elijah had talked with Apple Inc. and ByteDance’s Pico about launching the app on their competing VR platforms, he alleges in a lawsuit.
Meta canceled his AEI Fitness app days before its unveiling at Meta Connect, the world’s biggest VR conference, Elijah says.
He says the conference would have propelled it to the top of the VR fitness app market, eventually reaping him tens of millions of dollars.
It’s not the first time Meta has been accused of trying to corner the VR fitness app market.
The case is Andre Elijah Immersive Inc. v. Meta Platforms Technologies LLC, 5:23-cv-05159, US District Court, Northern District of California (San Jose).

title: Meta Quest 3 Shows Us The Metaverse Dream Isn't Dead Yet
summary:
The Metaverse Isn’t Dead Yet: Meta’s Quest 3Before I oversell the idea, the Meta Quest 3 is still going to be treated mainly as a gaming device, especially with access to Xbox Game Pass games coming soon.
That’s what enables you to view the real world and overlay interactive digital objects on top of that.
The Quest 2 offers only a grainy black-and-white view of the outer world that’s useless for anything other than making sure you don’t bump into the coffee table.
The Quest 3, by all accounts, isn’t quite that clear and detailed, but it’s also the version you’re much more likely to try.
At the very least, the Meta Quest 3 has a shot at being the Vision Pro for the rest of us.

summary:
This week, reports from BussinessInsider highlighted how Microsoft is closing down Project Airsim, an AI ambition tied to the firm’s Industrial Metaverse roadmap.
Moreover, the news comes after Microsoft shut down Bonsai, another acquired start-up set to play a significant role in the firm’s industrial Metaverse.
The Open AI technology integration also crosses over into Microsoft’s Industrial Metaverse, so the roadmap is far from discontinued.
Microsoft’s Industrial Metaverse Roadmap for 2024Reports covering Microsoft’s enterprise-grade Metaverse and MR headset solutions appeared sparse towards the start of 2023.
Moreover, it supports the idea that Microsoft is continuing to streamline the integration of emerging technologies into its industrial Metaverse – following the closure of Airsim and Bonsai.

description: University of Salford enters the Metaverse through digital twin | Read more on FE News!
title: University of Salford enters the Metaverse through digital twin
authors: ['Fe News Editor', 'Association Of Colleges', 'Aoc', 'Neil Wolstenholme', 'Kloodle Chairman', 'Diana Munoz', 'Leeds Trinity University', 'Gower College Swansea', 'South West College']
summary:
The University of Salford’s MediaCity campus is now available to visit as a 3D virtual environment thanks to a new partnership with an award-winning interactive software company.
With students and lecturers now inhabiting the space, the partnership is working with University programmes to design new virtual spaces for teaching purposes or incorporate virtual teaching elements into current modules.
Roger McKinley, Creative Technology and Content Manager of Creative Technical Services at the University of Salford said:“This virtual environment is as close as you can get to a digital twin of the ground floor of our MediaCity campus.
“It’s a flexible, digital space for any course looking to create, use and preserve assets that bridge digital and physical spaces, from architecture to fashion, archaeology to engineering and many others.
Louise Ready-Syrat, Programme Leader for BA Television and Radio Production said:“The Digital Twin project will be a huge resource for the programme and wider directorate of film, broadcast media and creative technology.

summary:

description: Mark Zuckerberg, head honcho of the organisation formerly known as Facebook, has completed his first interview entirely conducted within his company's eponymous Metaverse. And it's sort of i
title: Mark Zuckerberg's first interview entirely in the Metaverse is slightly ...
summary:
Mark Zuckerberg, head honcho of the organisation formerly known as Facebook, has completed his first interview entirely conducted within his company's eponymous Metaverse.
Zuckerberg hooked up with Lex Fridman for the interview, a podcaster by whom he has been interviewed on several previous occasions.
Zuckerberg and Fridman were remotely located from one another, Fridman in Austin Texas and Zuckerberg presumably at Meta's California head office.
Once each party has a copy of the other's digital avatar, the data required to animate them is much less than for, say, transmitting high definition digital video.
Still, there's a slightly flat, digitised feel to the avatars that probably isn't entirely down to physical the bearing of Zuckerberg and Fridman.

description: Solana is this week’s biggest gainer, but another token has topped the charts over the past day, with Decentraland’s MANA up 12%.

summary:

MANA has posted a nearly 12% gain over the past 24 hours, according to data from CoinGecko, jumping to a current price of $0.40 per token.
Overall, MANA is up 16% over the last week and a towering 47% in the past two weeks.
Those up-and-down swings are typical among gaming tokens.

title: UAE's Metaverse pioneer Everdome launches SPACES (MaaS ...
summary:
The Dubai based Metaverse project Everdome has unveiled SPACES – the debut release of their new Metaverse-as-a-Service product line, which aims to make the Metaverse more accessible for all.
Everdome seeks to change this with their new SPACES application, which will deliver easy-to-use, customisable and engaging Metaverse pop-up spaces that can be created in a matter of minutes.
SPACES will allow users without deep technical knowledge to quickly produce Metaverse experiences which can last for days, weeks or even a matter of hours as a Metaverse pop-up space.
Created as a stand-alone application from their hyper-realistic Mars Metaverse environment, SPACES addresses the on-going challenge of accessibility in Metaverse development, allowing a wider audience to take their first steps into the web3 world.
Everdome CEO Jeremy Lopez is spearheading this drive to improve Metaverse engagement to a wider audience.

description: UoG has unveiled the £5.6m “Museums in the Metaverse” project, bringing together history and culture with extended reality.
title: Glasgow Uni unveils £5.6m "Museums in the Metaverse" project
summary:
Backed by funding from the UK Government’s Innovation Accelerator programme, the project itself is a two-sided XR — a catch-all term for immersive technology including virtual reality, augmented reality, and mixed reality — platform.
One part of the platform will enable people to access an array of museums, sites, objects, and dynamic experiences virtually.
The Museums in the Metaverse team, led by Professor Neil McDonnell at Glasgow, noted that while virtual museums won’t replace the experience of visiting a traditional museum in-person, they hope XR will enhance the offerings of traditional museums.
Museums in the Metaverse can help liberate these collections and will allow museums the freedom to connect with their audiences in new and exciting ways.
Moreover, Museums in the Metaverse will let anyone create their own virtual museums and tell their own stories with objects from all around the world.”Header photo by Martin Shields.

description: Generative AI has captured the collective imagination for the moment, eclipsing the once-hyped metaverse. However, it's not the end of virtual reality. A case study by Andy Wu and David Yoffie lays out the key challenges immersive 3D technology must overcome to be truly transformative.
title: (Virtual) Reality Check: How Long Before We Live in the 'Metaverse'?
summary:
At this point, it seems that AI has eclipsed the metaverse as the next “big thing” in technology, the “Metaverse Wars” case notes.
“For the last 10 years, metaverse and virtual reality have always been one year away or five years away,” Wu says.
And, of course, “young people today are already living in a 3D virtual world,” via Roblox, Minecraft, and other gaming platforms, Wu says.
Linden Lab’s Second Life game, with its open-world multiuser virtual environment, has also played a key role in demonstrating the potential of metaverse technology.
But it may not be one virtual world.

description: Discover why you should care about the metaverse, the next generation of the internet that will transform online experiences.
title: 5 Reasons To Still Care About The Metaverse
summary:
5 Reasons To Still Care About The Metaverse Adobe StockBut first, a very quick refresher: What is the metaverse?
The metaverse is all about persistent, shared virtual worlds – immersive digital spaces where we can work, play, socialize, shop, learn, exercise, and more.
You get the idea – as the metaverse evolves, more and more of our everyday lives will take place in shared virtual worlds.
But we already have cities like Dubai working on creating digital replicas of real-world places for the metaverse – digital twins if you will.
And finally, the metaverse will transform businessesMake no mistake, the metaverse is where brands will connect with their audiences.

description: We’re announcing a new program to help college students in the US learn using VR.
title: Metaverse Technologies Are Creating New Opportunities for Teachers to Inspire Students
summary:
Metaverse technologies like Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) promise to create new ways for teachers to inspire students.
In a randomized control study of the VR mathematics program Prisms, students learning in VR had test scores 11% higher than those in the control group.
Growing Momentum for VR Education Tools in EuropeWe’re also seeing encouraging signs of educators embracing metaverse technologies in Europe.
Europe is also home to a growing sector of companies developing education apps and software for metaverse technologies.
We remain hugely optimistic about the impact metaverse technologies can have – and are already having – on education.

description: The industrial metaverse enables more resilient supply chains and localized manufacturing through the use of existing tools such as digital twins.
title: Solve real-world problems with the industrial metaverse
summary:
The industrial metaverse enables more resilient supply chains and localized manufacturing through the use of existing tools such as digital twins.
The industrial metaverse goes to workThe digital twin, a virtual model of a real-world object, is the cornerstone of the industrial metaverse.
Expectations for the industrial metaverse are high for a number of reasons.
“It creates a sandbox or playground in which you can build and construct new things.”Potential industrial metaverse use cases include the following:Improved design and engineering.
“We are trying to solve real-world problems in the industrial metaverse, which means all the things have to behave exactly the same way as they do in real life,” he said.

description: Discover how the metaverse can revolutionize your business operations, from immersive marketing strategies and customer support in VR to collaborative remote work.
title: 4 Ways The Metaverse May (Positively) Impact Your Business ...
summary:
There is no doubt about it: the next evolution of the internet – characterized by immersive virtual experiences – is already underway.
4 Ways The Metaverse May (Positively) Impact Your Business Operations Adobe StockHere are four examples of how organizations can harness this more immersive future internet in their business operations.
Delivering Customer Support In The MetaverseWelcome to the age of metaverse customer service – in which businesses can support and communicate with customers in 3D in real-time.
Or you can make yourself at home in one of the existing metaverse platforms, like Meta’s Horizon Workrooms – an immersive virtual office and meeting room environment.
Such immersive training solutions mean training can be conducted on-site and be highly customized.

description: The Nation Magazine
title: Lessons From the Catastrophic Failure of the Metaverse
authors: ['Kate Wagner', 'October', 'September', 'James Bamford', 'Barry Schwabsky', 'Chris Lehmann', 'Ethan Iverson', 'Michael Bennett', 'Emanuele Del Rosso', 'Hannah Story Brown']
summary:
This desire, it should be noted, is applied unevenly among virtual spaces and ideas.
Museums have been adding virtual reality elements as a teaching tool since the technology became available.
In our contemporary, monetized version of the net, Zuckerberg does have a point: People want to spend time in virtual spaces and they are important for socialization.
Just not his virtual spaces.
Brands know this; many like Gucci and Nike have begun staging events and product launches in these virtual spaces, trying to capitalize on younger and younger eyeballs.

description: Explore the six critical challenges — from legal grey areas and privacy concerns to energy costs and skills shortages — that stand in the way of the metaverse and Web3
title: 6 Roadblocks Stopping Web3 And The Metaverse Becoming A Reality
summary:
With the emergence of the metaverse and web3 technologies, it’s clear that the next evolution of the internet is already underway.
6 Roadblocks Stopping Web3 And The Metaverse Becoming A Reality Adobe StockThis future internet will deliver a much more engaging, enriching and realistic online experience.
But there are many hurdles to overcome on this road toward a more immersive, decentralized future internet.
If I’m physically at home in England, but I’m exploring a virtual metaverse environment hosted by a Chinese provider, will I be subject to English laws or Chinese?
On Top Of All That, There’s The Future Internet Skills ShortageThere’s a massive skills shortage around metaverse and web3 technologies.

description: China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT)said on Monday that it will form a working group to establish standards for the metaverse sector as Beijing seeks to be a global standards-setter for new technology.
title: China's industry ministry to work on standards for the metaverse
summary:
The ministry released a draft proposal to form a working group for the metaverse, shared virtual worlds accessible via the internet, on Monday.
The proposal said that the metaverse is one of the nine emerging tech sectors which China should strive to establish standards for.
"[The metaverse industry] faces many challenges," the MIIT said, "It is urgent to promote healthy and orderly development of the metaverse industry through standardization and guidance."
It added that the metaverse industry suffers from a lack of clear definitions, which had allowed some capitalists and companies to drum up speculation in the market.
Reporting by Josh Ye in Hong Kong and Beijing newsroom, Editing by Louise Heavens and Emelia Sithole-MatariseOur Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.
